org.threadly.concurrent

Interface SchedulerServiceInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Executor, SimpleSchedulerInterface, SubmitterExecutorInterface, SubmitterSchedulerInterface
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    PrioritySchedulerInterface
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    NoThreadScheduler, PriorityScheduledExecutor, PrioritySchedulerLimiter, PrioritySchedulerStatisticTracker, PrioritySchedulerWrapper, SchedulerServiceLimiter, SingleThreadScheduler, TestableScheduler

    public interface SchedulerServiceInterface
extends SubmitterSchedulerInterface

    This interface adds some more advanced features to a scheduler that are more service oriented. Things like a concept of running/shutdown, as well as removing tasks are not always easy to implement.

    Since:
    2.0.0

    • Method Detail

      • remove

        boolean remove(java.lang.Runnable task)
        Removes the runnable task from the execution queue. It is possible for the runnable to still run until this call has returned.
        Parameters:
        task - The original task provided to the executor
        Returns:
        true if the task was found and removed

      • remove

        boolean remove(java.util.concurrent.Callable<?> task)
        Removes the runnable task from the execution queue. It is possible for the callable to still run until this call has returned.
        Parameters:
        task - The original callable provided to the executor
        Returns:
        true if the callable was found and removed

      • isShutdown

        boolean isShutdown()
        Function to check if the thread pool is currently accepting and handling tasks.
        Returns:
        true if thread pool is running
